decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed single storey side extension, by reason of its excessive width when considered in combination with the proposed two storey side extension and its poor wedge shaped design on a prominent location would result in an unduly wide and bulky form of development and would be greater in width than the original dwellinghouse resulting in a discordant and incongruous development, out of keeping with the established pattern of development and detracts from the appearance of the host building and harms the visual amenities of the streetscene, contrary to the high-quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021),  Policy D3.D(1) and D3.D(11) of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1 (B) of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).

Reason : 2 - The proposed first floor rear extension by reason of its overall width in relation to the original host dwelling and the poor design of the proposed rear dormer would result in an unduly wide, bulky and incongruous form of development, which would be out of keeping with the proportions, character and appearance of the host dwelling and the wider area, contrary to the high-quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021),  Policy D3.D(1) and D3.D(11) of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1(B) of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).
description: Single and two storey side to rear extension; single storey rear extension; alterations to roof; rear dormer; rooflights in front, side and rear roofslopes; external alterations (demolition of detached garage)
